verses.text: Her father said, “I really thought that you thoroughly hated her; therefore I gave her to your companion. Is not her younger sister better than she? Please, take her instead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Samson said to them, “This time I shall be blameless regarding the Philistines if I harm them!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Samson went and caught three hundred foxes; and he took torches, turned the foxes tail to tail, and put a torch between each pair of tails.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had set the torches on fire, he let the foxes go into the standing grain of the Philistines, and burned up both the shocks and the standing grain, as well as the vineyards and olive groves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Philistines said, “Who has done this?”
And they answered, “Samson, the son-in-law of the Timnite, because he has taken his wife and given her to his companion.” So the Philistines came up and burned her and her father with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Samson said to them, “Since you would do a thing like this, I will surely take revenge on you, and after that I will cease.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he attacked them hip and thigh with a great slaughter; then he went down and dwelt in the cleft of the rock of Etam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Philistines went up, encamped in Judah, and deployed themselves against Lehi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the men of Judah said, “Why have you come up against us?”
So they answered, “We have come up to arrest Samson, to do to him as he has done to us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then three thousand men of Judah went down to the cleft of the rock of Etam, and said to Samson, “Do you not know that the Philistines rule over us? What is this you have done to us?”
And he said to them, “As they did to me, so I have done to them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But they said to him, “We have come down to arrest you, that we may deliver you into the hand of the Philistines.”
Then Samson said to them, “Swear to me that you will not kill me yourselves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they spoke to him, saying, “No, but we will tie you securely and deliver you into their hand; but we will surely not kill you.” And they bound him with two new ropes and brought him up from the rock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he came to Lehi, the Philistines came shouting against him. Then the Spirit of the Lord came mightily upon him; and the ropes that were on his arms became like flax that is burned with fire, and his bonds broke loose from his hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He found a fresh jawbone of a donkey, reached out his hand and took it, and killed a thousand men with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Samson said:
“With the jawbone of a donkey,
Heaps upon heaps,
With the jawbone of a donkey
I have slain a thousand men!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so it was, when he had finished speaking, that he threw the jawbone from his hand, and called that place Ramath Lehi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he became very thirsty; so he cried out to the Lord and said, “You have given this great deliverance by the hand of Your servant; and now shall I die of thirst and fall into the hand of the uncircumcised?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So God split the hollow place that is in Lehi, and water came out, and he drank; and his spirit returned, and he revived. Therefore he called its name En Hakkore, which is in Lehi to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he judged Israel twenty years in the days of the Philistines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Samson went to Gaza and saw a harlot there, and went in to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Gazites were told, “Samson has come here!” they surrounded the place and lay in wait for him all night at the gate of the city. They were quiet all night, saying, “In the morning, when it is daylight, we will kill him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Samson lay low till midnight; then he arose at midnight, took hold of the doors of the gate of the city and the two gateposts, pulled them up, bar and all, put them on his shoulders, and carried them to the top of the hill that faces Hebron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward it happened that he loved a woman in the Valley of Sorek, whose name was Delilah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the lords of the Philistines came up to her and said to her, “Entice him, and find out where his great strength lies, and by what means we may overpower him, that we may bind him to afflict him; and every one of us will give you eleven hundred pieces of silver.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Delilah said to Samson, “Please tell me where your great strength lies, and with what you may be bound to afflict you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Samson said to her, “If they bind me with seven fresh bowstrings, not yet dried, then I shall become weak, and be like any other man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the lords of the Philistines brought up to her seven fresh bowstrings, not yet dried, and she bound him with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now men were lying in wait, staying with her in the room. And she said to him, “The Philistines are upon you, Samson!” But he broke the bowstrings as a strand of yarn breaks when it touches fire. So the secret of his strength was not known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Delilah said to Samson, “Look, you have mocked me and told me lies. Now, please tell me what you may be bound with.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said to her, “If they bind me securely with new ropes that have never been used, then I shall become weak, and be like any other man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Delilah took new ropes and bound him with them, and said to him, “The Philistines are upon you, Samson!” And men were lying in wait, staying in the room. But he broke them off his arms like a thread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Delilah said to Samson, “Until now you have mocked me and told me lies. Tell me what you may be bound with.”
And he said to her, “If you weave the seven locks of my head into the web of the loom”—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she wove it tightly with the batten of the loom, and said to him, “The Philistines are upon you, Samson!” But he awoke from his sleep, and pulled out the batten and the web from the loom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she said to him, “How can you say, ‘I love you,’ when your heart is not with me? You have mocked me these three times, and have not told me where your great strength lies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, when she pestered him daily with her words and pressed him, so that his soul was vexed to death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that he told her all his heart, and said to her, “No razor has ever come upon my head, for I have been a Nazirite to God from my mother’s womb. If I am shaven, then my strength will leave me, and I shall become weak, and be like any other man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Delilah saw that he had told her all his heart, she sent and called for the lords of the Philistines, saying, “Come up once more, for he has told me all his heart.” So the lords of the Philistines came up to her and brought the money in their hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she lulled him to sleep on her knees, and called for a man and had him shave off the seven locks of his head. Then she began to torment him, and his strength left him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she said, “The Philistines are upon you, Samson!” So he awoke from his sleep, and said, “I will go out as before, at other times, and shake myself free!” But he did not know that the Lord had departed from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Philistines took him and put out his eyes, and brought him down to Gaza. They bound him with bronze fetters, and he became a grinder in the prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, the hair of his head began to grow again after it had been shaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now the lords of the Philistines gathered together to offer a great sacrifice to Dagon their god, and to rejoice. And they said:
“Our god has delivered into our hands
Samson our enemy!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the people saw him, they praised their god; for they said:
“Our god has delivered into our hands our enemy,
The destroyer of our land,
And the one who multiplied our dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it happened, when their hearts were merry, that they said, “Call for Samson, that he may perform for us.” So they called for Samson from the prison, and he performed for them. And they stationed him between the pillars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Samson said to the lad who held him by the hand, “Let me feel the pillars which support the temple, so that I can lean on them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the temple was full of men and women. All the lords of the Philistines were there—about three thousand men and women on the roof watching while Samson performed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Samson called to the Lord, saying, “O Lord God, remember me, I pray! Strengthen me, I pray, just this once, O God, that I may with one blow take vengeance on the Philistines for my two eyes!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Samson took hold of the two middle pillars which supported the temple, and he braced himself against them, one on his right and the other on his left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Samson said, “Let me die with the Philistines!” And he pushed with all his might, and the temple fell on the lords and all the people who were in it. So the dead that he killed at his death were more than he had killed in his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his brothers and all his father’s household came down and took him, and brought him up and buried him between Zorah and Eshtaol in the tomb of his father Manoah. He had judged Israel twenty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a man from the mountains of Ephraim, whose name was Micah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he said to his mother, “The eleven hundred shekels of silver that were taken from you, and on which you put a curse, even saying it in my ears—here is the silver with me; I took it.”
And his mother said, “May you be blessed by the Lord, my son!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when he had returned the eleven hundred shekels of silver to his mother, his mother said, “I had wholly dedicated the silver from my hand to the Lord for my son, to make a carved image and a molded image; now therefore, I will return it to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus he returned the silver to his mother. Then his mother took two hundred shekels of silver and gave them to the silversmith, and he made it into a carved image and a molded image; and they were in the house of Micah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man Micah had a shrine, and made an ephod and household idols; and he consecrated one of his sons, who became his priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days there was no king in Israel; everyone did what was right in his own eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a young man from Bethlehem in Judah, of the family of Judah; he was a Levite, and was staying there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man departed from the city of Bethlehem in Judah to stay wherever he could find a place. Then he came to the mountains of Ephraim, to the house of Micah, as he journeyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And Micah said to him, “Where do you come from?”
So he said to him, “I am a Levite from Bethlehem in Judah, and I am on my way to find a place to stay.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Micah said to him, “Dwell with me, and be a father and a priest to me, and I will give you ten shekels of silver per year, a suit of clothes, and your sustenance.” So the Levite went in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Levite was content to dwell with the man; and the young man became like one of his sons to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Micah consecrated the Levite, and the young man became his priest, and lived in the house of Micah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Micah said, “Now I know that the Lord will be good to me, since I have a Levite as priest!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days there was no king in Israel. And in those days the tribe of the Danites was seeking an inheritance for itself to dwell in; for until that day their inheritance among the tribes of Israel had not fallen to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the children of Dan sent five men of their family from their territory, men of valor from Zorah and Eshtaol, to spy out the land and search it. They said to them, “Go, search the land.” So they went to the mountains of Ephraim, to the house of Micah, and lodged there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were at the house of Micah, they recognized the voice of the young Levite. They turned aside and said to him, “Who brought you here? What are you doing in this place? What do you have here?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Thus and so Micah did for me. He has hired me, and I have become his priest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they said to him, “Please inquire of God, that we may know whether the journey on which we go will be prosperous.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest said to them, “Go in peace. The presence of the Lord be with you on your way.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the five men departed and went to Laish. They saw the people who were there, how they dwelt safely, in the manner of the Sidonians, quiet and secure. There were no rulers in the land who might put them to shame for anything. They were far from the Sidonians, and they had no ties with anyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the spies came back to their brethren at Zorah and Eshtaol, and their brethren said to them, “What is your report?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they said, “Arise, let us go up against them. For we have seen the land, and indeed it is very good. Would you do nothing? Do not hesitate to go, and enter to possess the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you go, you will come to a secure people and a large land. For God has given it into your hands, a place where there is no lack of anything that is on the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And six hundred men of the family of the Danites went from there, from Zorah and Eshtaol, armed with weapons of war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they went up and encamped in Kirjath Jearim in Judah. (Therefore they call that place Mahaneh Dan to this day. There it is, west of Kirjath Jearim.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they passed from there to the mountains of Ephraim, and came to the house of Micah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the five men who had gone to spy out the country of Laish answered and said to their brethren, “Do you know that there are in these houses an ephod, household idols, a carved image, and a molded image? Now therefore, consider what you should do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they turned aside there, and came to the house of the young Levite man—to the house of Micah—and greeted him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The six hundred men armed with their weapons of war, who were of the children of Dan, stood by the entrance of the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the five men who had gone to spy out the land went up. Entering there, they took the carved image, the ephod, the household idols, and the molded image. The priest stood at the entrance of the gate with the six hundred men who were armed with weapons of war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When these went into Micah’s house and took the carved image, the ephod, the household idols, and the molded image, the priest said to them, “What are you doing?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to him, “Be quiet, put your hand over your mouth, and come with us; be a father and a priest to us. Is it better for you to be a priest to the household of one man, or that you be a priest to a tribe and a family in Israel?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the priest’s heart was glad; and he took the ephod, the household idols, and the carved image, and took his place among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they turned and departed, and put the little ones, the livestock, and the goods in front of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they were a good way from the house of Micah, the men who were in the houses near Micah’s house gathered together and overtook the children of Dan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they called out to the children of Dan. So they turned around and said to Micah, “What ails you, that you have gathered such a company?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said, “You have taken away my gods which I made, and the priest, and you have gone away. Now what more do I have? How can you say to me, ‘What ails you?’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the children of Dan said to him, “Do not let your voice be heard among us, lest angry men fall upon you, and you lose your life, with the lives of your household!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the children of Dan went their way. And when Micah saw that they were too strong for him, he turned and went back to his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they took the things Micah had made, and the priest who had belonged to him, and went to Laish, to a people quiet and secure; and they struck them with the edge of the sword and burned the city with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was no deliverer, because it was far from Sidon, and they had no ties with anyone. It was in the valley that belongs to Beth Rehob. So they rebuilt the city and dwelt there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they called the name of the city Dan, after the name of Dan their father, who was born to Israel. However, the name of the city formerly was Laish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the children of Dan set up for themselves the carved image; and Jonathan the son of Gershom, the son of Manasseh, and his sons were priests to the tribe of Dan until the day of the captivity of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they set up for themselves Micah’s carved image which he made, all the time that the house of God was in Shiloh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass in those days, when there was no king in Israel, that there was a certain Levite staying in the remote mountains of Ephraim. He took for himself a concubine from Bethlehem in Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But his concubine played the harlot against him, and went away from him to her father’s house at Bethlehem in Judah, and was there four whole months.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then her husband arose and went after her, to speak kindly to her and bring her back, having his servant and a couple of donkeys with him. So she brought him into her father’s house; and when the father of the young woman saw him, he was glad to meet him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now his father-in-law, the young woman’s father, detained him; and he stayed with him three days. So they ate and drank and lodged there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it came to pass on the fourth day that they arose early in the morning, and he stood to depart; but the young woman’s father said to his son-in-law, “Refresh your heart with a morsel of bread, and afterward go your way.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they sat down, and the two of them ate and drank together. Then the young woman’s father said to the man, “Please be content to stay all night, and let your heart be merry.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the man stood to depart, his father-in-law urged him; so he lodged there again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he arose early in the morning on the fifth day to depart, but the young woman’s father said, “Please refresh your heart.” So they delayed until afternoon; and both of them ate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the man stood to depart—he and his concubine and his servant—his father-in-law, the young woman’s father, said to him, “Look, the day is now drawing toward evening; please spend the night. See, the day is coming to an end; lodge here, that your heart may be merry. Tomorrow go your way early, so that you may get home.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, the man was not willing to spend that night; so he rose and departed, and came opposite Jebus (that is, Jerusalem). With him were the two saddled donkeys; his concubine was also with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were near Jebus, and the day was far spent; and the servant said to his master, “Come, please, and let us turn aside into this city of the Jebusites and lodge in it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But his master said to him, “We will not turn aside here into a city of foreigners, who are not of the children of Israel; we will go on to Gibeah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said to his servant, “Come, let us draw near to one of these places, and spend the night in Gibeah or in Ramah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they passed by and went their way; and the sun went down on them near Gibeah, which belongs to Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They turned aside there to go in to lodge in Gibeah. And when he went in, he sat down in the open square of the city, for no one would take them into his house to spend the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just then an old man came in from his work in the field at evening, who also was from the mountains of Ephraim; he was staying in Gibeah, whereas the men of the place were Benjamites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he raised his eyes, he saw the traveler in the open square of the city; and the old man said, “Where are you going, and where do you come from?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said to him, “We are passing from Bethlehem in Judah toward the remote mountains of Ephraim; I am from there. I went to Bethlehem in Judah; now I am going to the house of the Lord. But there is no one who will take me into his house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: although we have both straw and fodder for our donkeys, and bread and wine for myself, for your female servant, and for the young man who is with your servant; there is no lack of anything.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the old man said, “Peace be with you! However, let all your needs be my responsibility; only do not spend the night in the open square.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he brought him into his house, and gave fodder to the donkeys. And they washed their feet, and ate and drank.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were enjoying themselves, suddenly certain men of the city, perverted men, surrounded the house and beat on the door. They spoke to the master of the house, the old man, saying, “Bring out the man who came to your house, that we may know him carnally!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the man, the master of the house, went out to them and said to them, “No, my brethren! I beg you, do not act so wickedly! Seeing this man has come into my house, do not commit this outrage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look, here is my virgin daughter and the man’s concubine; let me bring them out now. Humble them, and do with them as you please; but to this man do not do such a vile thing!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the men would not heed him. So the man took his concubine and brought her out to them. And they knew her and abused her all night until morning; and when the day began to break, they let her go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the woman came as the day was dawning, and fell down at the door of the man’s house where her master was, till it was light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When her master arose in the morning, and opened the doors of the house and went out to go his way, there was his concubine, fallen at the door of the house with her hands on the threshold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to her, “Get up and let us be going.” But there was no answer. So the man lifted her onto the donkey; and the man got up and went to his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he entered his house he took a knife, laid hold of his concubine, and divided her into twelve pieces, limb by limb, and sent her throughout all the territory of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so it was that all who saw it said, “No such deed has been done or seen from the day that the children of Israel came up from the land of Egypt until this day. Consider it, confer, and speak up!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the children of Israel came out, from Dan to Beersheba, as well as from the land of Gilead, and the congregation gathered together as one man before the Lord at Mizpah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the leaders of all the people, all the tribes of Israel, presented themselves in the assembly of the people of God, four hundred thousand foot soldiers who drew the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
(Now the children of Benjamin heard that the children of Israel had gone up to Mizpah.)
Then the children of Israel said, “Tell us, how did this wicked deed happen?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Levite, the husband of the woman who was murdered, answered and said, “My concubine and I went into Gibeah, which belongs to Benjamin, to spend the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the men of Gibeah rose against me, and surrounded the house at night because of me. They intended to kill me, but instead they ravished my concubine so that she died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I took hold of my concubine, cut her in pieces, and sent her throughout all the territory of the inheritance of Israel, because they committed lewdness and outrage in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look! All of you are children of Israel; give your advice and counsel here and now!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the people arose as one man, saying, “None of us will go to his tent, nor will any turn back to his house;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but now this is the thing which we will do to Gibeah: We will go up against it by lot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We will take ten men out of every hundred throughout all the tribes of Israel, a hundred out of every thousand, and a thousand out of every ten thousand, to make provisions for the people, that when they come to Gibeah in Benjamin, they may repay all the vileness that they have done in Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the men of Israel were gathered against the city, united together as one man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the tribes of Israel sent men through all the tribe of Benjamin, saying, “What is this wickedness that has occurred among you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, deliver up the men, the perverted men who are in Gibeah, that we may put them to death and remove the evil from Israel!” But the children of Benjamin would not listen to the voice of their brethren, the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, the children of Benjamin gathered together from their cities to Gibeah, to go to battle against the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from their cities at that time the children of Benjamin numbered twenty-six thousand men who drew the sword, besides the inhabitants of Gibeah, who numbered seven hundred select men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Among all this people were seven hundred select men who were left-handed; every one could sling a stone at a hair’s breadth and not miss.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now besides Benjamin, the men of Israel numbered four hundred thousand men who drew the sword; all of these were men of war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the children of Israel arose and went up to the house of God to inquire of God. They said, “Which of us shall go up first to battle against the children of Benjamin?”
The Lord said, “Judah first!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the children of Israel rose in the morning and encamped against Gibeah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the men of Israel went out to battle against Benjamin, and the men of Israel put themselves in battle array to fight against them at Gibeah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the children of Benjamin came out of Gibeah, and on that day cut down to the ground twenty-two thousand men of the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people, that is, the men of Israel, encouraged themselves and again formed the battle line at the place where they had put themselves in array on the first day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the children of Israel went up and wept before the Lord until evening, and asked counsel of the Lord, saying, “Shall I again draw near for battle against the children of my brother Benjamin?”
And the Lord said, “Go up against him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the children of Israel approached the children of Benjamin on the second day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Benjamin went out against them from Gibeah on the second day, and cut down to the ground eighteen thousand more of the children of Israel; all these drew the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the children of Israel, that is, all the people, went up and came to the house of God and wept. They sat there before the Lord and fasted that day until evening; and they offered burnt offerings and peace offerings before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the children of Israel inquired of the Lord (the ark of the covenant of God was there in those days,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and Phinehas the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron, stood before it in those days), saying, “Shall I yet again go out to battle against the children of my brother Benjamin, or shall I cease?”
And the Lord said, “Go up, for tomorrow I will deliver them into your hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Israel set men in ambush all around Gibeah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the children of Israel went up against the children of Benjamin on the third day, and put themselves in battle array against Gibeah as at the other times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the children of Benjamin went out against the people, and were drawn away from the city. They began to strike down and kill some of the people, as at the other times, in the highways (one of which goes up to Bethel and the other to Gibeah) and in the field, about thirty men of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the children of Benjamin said, “They are defeated before us, as at first.”
But the children of Israel said, “Let us flee and draw them away from the city to the highways.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the men of Israel rose from their place and put themselves in battle array at Baal Tamar. Then Israel’s men in ambush burst forth from their position in the plain of Geba.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ten thousand select men from all Israel came against Gibeah, and the battle was fierce. But the Benjamites did not know that disaster was upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord defeated Benjamin before Israel. And the children of Israel destroyed that day twenty-five thousand one hundred Benjamites; all these drew the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the children of Benjamin saw that they were defeated. The men of Israel had given ground to the Benjamites, because they relied on the men in ambush whom they had set against Gibeah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the men in ambush quickly rushed upon Gibeah; the men in ambush spread out and struck the whole city with the edge of the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the appointed signal between the men of Israel and the men in ambush was that they would make a great cloud of smoke rise up from the city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whereupon the men of Israel would turn in battle. Now Benjamin had begun to strike and kill about thirty of the men of Israel. For they said, “Surely they are defeated before us, as in the first battle.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the cloud began to rise from the city in a column of smoke, the Benjamites looked behind them, and there was the whole city going up in smoke to heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the men of Israel turned back, the men of Benjamin panicked, for they saw that disaster had come upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore they turned their backs before the men of Israel in the direction of the wilderness; but the battle overtook them, and whoever came out of the cities they destroyed in their midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They surrounded the Benjamites, chased them, and easily trampled them down as far as the front of Gibeah toward the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And eighteen thousand men of Benjamin fell; all these were men of valor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they turned and fled toward the wilderness to the rock of Rimmon; and they cut down five thousand of them on the highways. Then they pursued them relentlessly up to Gidom, and killed two thousand of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all who fell of Benjamin that day were twenty-five thousand men who drew the sword; all these were men of valor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But six hundred men turned and fled toward the wilderness to the rock of Rimmon, and they stayed at the rock of Rimmon for four months.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the men of Israel turned back against the children of Benjamin, and struck them down with the edge of the sword—from every city, men and beasts, all who were found. They also set fire to all the cities they came to.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the men of Israel had sworn an oath at Mizpah, saying, “None of us shall give his daughter to Benjamin as a wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people came to the house of God, and remained there before God till evening. They lifted up their voices and wept bitterly,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “O Lord God of Israel, why has this come to pass in Israel, that today there should be one tribe missing in Israel?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it was, on the next morning, that the people rose early and built an altar there, and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel said, “Who is there among all the tribes of Israel who did not come up with the assembly to the Lord?” For they had made a great oath concerning anyone who had not come up to the Lord at Mizpah, saying, “He shall surely be put to death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the children of Israel grieved for Benjamin their brother, and said, “One tribe is cut off from Israel today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What shall we do for wives for those who remain, seeing we have sworn by the Lord that we will not give them our daughters as wives?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “What one is there from the tribes of Israel who did not come up to Mizpah to the Lord?” And, in fact, no one had come to the camp from Jabesh Gilead to the assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when the people were counted, indeed, not one of the inhabitants of Jabesh Gilead was there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the congregation sent out there twelve thousand of their most valiant men, and commanded them, saying, “Go and strike the inhabitants of Jabesh Gilead with the edge of the sword, including the women and children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is the thing that you shall do: You shall utterly destroy every male, and every woman who has known a man intimately.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they found among the inhabitants of Jabesh Gilead four hundred young virgins who had not known a man intimately; and they brought them to the camp at Shiloh, which is in the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the whole congregation sent word to the children of Benjamin who were at the rock of Rimmon, and announced peace to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Benjamin came back at that time, and they gave them the women whom they had saved alive of the women of Jabesh Gilead; and yet they had not found enough for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people grieved for Benjamin, because the Lord had made a void in the tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the elders of the congregation said, “What shall we do for wives for those who remain, since the women of Benjamin have been destroyed?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “There must be an inheritance for the survivors of Benjamin, that a tribe may not be destroyed from Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, we cannot give them wives from our daughters, for the children of Israel have sworn an oath, saying, ‘Cursed be the one who gives a wife to Benjamin.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said, “In fact, there is a yearly feast of the Lord in Shiloh, which is north of Bethel, on the east side of the highway that goes up from Bethel to Shechem, and south of Lebonah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore they instructed the children of Benjamin, saying, “Go, lie in wait in the vineyards,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and watch; and just when the daughters of Shiloh come out to perform their dances, then come out from the vineyards, and every man catch a wife for himself from the daughters of Shiloh; then go to the land of Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it shall be, when their fathers or their brothers come to us to complain, that we will say to them, ‘Be kind to them for our sakes, because we did not take a wife for any of them in the war; for it is not as though you have given the women to them at this time, making yourselves guilty of your oath.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the children of Benjamin did so; they took enough wives for their number from those who danced, whom they caught. Then they went and returned to their inheritance, and they rebuilt the cities and dwelt in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the children of Israel departed from there at that time, every man to his tribe and family; they went out from there, every man to his inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days there was no king in Israel; everyone did what was right in his own eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator
